intro: Ervilia sativa, commonly known as the common vervain, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant features square stems, opposite leaves, and small, two-lipped flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Ervilia sativa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
